title: Mourning the death of Carl L. Helstrom, distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  mourning the death of Carl L. Helstrom, distin-
guished citizen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Carl L. Helstrom, a  lifelong  resident  of  Montgomery,  New
York, died on Sunday, December 19, 2010, at the age of 84; and
  WHEREAS,  Born  on  February  2, 1926, Carl L. Helstrom graduated from
Walden High School in 1944; he lived on a poultry and dairy  farm  until
he was 36 years old; and
  WHEREAS,  Carl  L. Helstrom was the Manager of Central Co-op in Gardi-
ner, New York; he belonged to 4-H, the Orange County Farm Bureau and was
a member of the Montgomery Milk Co-op; and
  WHEREAS, In addition, Carl L. Helstrom was the President of the  Mont-
gomery Little League and served as the Tax Collector, Councilman, Super-
visor and Planning Board member for the Town of Montgomery; and
  WHEREAS, A member of the Orange County Supervisors and Mayors' Associ-
ation,  Carl  L. Helstrom served as Vice President and President; he was
also a charter member of the Town of  Montgomery  Chamber  of  Commerce,
serving as Vice President and President; and
  WHEREAS,  Carl  L. Helstrom belonged to the Wallkill Masonic Lodge and
was a member of the Brick Reformed Church for more than 50 years,  serv-
ing  as  Deacon,  Elder and Treasurer; he was also Vice Treasurer of the
church consistory; and
  WHEREAS, Carl L. Helstrom tried  to  attend  all  his  children's  and
grandchildren's  sporting  events over the years, including traveling to
Oneonta to proudly watch his granddaughter play softball for SUNY Oneon-
ta; his hobbies included countless games of  solitaire  and  challenging
his grandchildren to many games of Liverpool rummy; he enjoyed gardening
and loved the "good earth"; and
  WHEREAS, Predeceased by his brother, Albert Helstrom, Carl L. Helstrom
is  survived  by  his  wife  of 56 years, Ruth Ellen Roney Helstrom; his
children, Gary (Camille), Bruce (AnneMarie), Carl A., and  Lisa  (Doug);
and his grandchildren, Keith (Amy) Boeckmann, Michael (Alyson) Helstrom,
Karla  (James)  Tombrello,  LeeAnn  Higinson, Jennifer Higinson, Michael
Higinson, Lindsay Higinson, and Melissa (Elijah) Howe, as well  as  many
nieces, nephews, and cousins; and
  WHEREAS,  Armed  with  a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with a sense of
compassion, and comforted by a loving family, Carl  L.  Helstrom  leaves
behind  a  legacy  which  will  long endure the passage of time and will
remain as a comforting memory to all  he  served  and  befriended;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
mourn the death of Carl L. Helstrom, distinguished citizen  and  devoted
member of his community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Carl L. Helstrom.
